N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2203.1 - Payment

State Regulations
(a) Academic
performance awards shall be available for a period of four years within a
consecutive seven-year period commencing with the beginning of the academic
year in which the award is granted. Recipients requesting payment of academic
performance awards shall annually file with the corporation an application
pursuant to section
2201.1
(a) of this

Subchapter. (b) For any academic
performance award which is reawarded, the corporation may grant a leave of
absence during the academic year in which the award is first granted. A
recipient requesting such a leave shall file, prior to the deadline for filing
a student payment application, a written request for leave. Such request shall
be granted only for those reasons outlined in section
145-1.9
of this Title. The leave
shall not extend the seven-year period for which an award is
available. (c) Upon the receipt of
a written request prior to the deadline for submission of a payment
application, an extension of the seven-year period may be granted for the
following reasons: (1)
active service in the

Armed Forces of the United States; (2)
active service in the national welfare in
a program such as the Peace Corps. Such extension shall be limited to the period of service
but in no event shall exceed three years. Written requests for a leave of
absence made pursuant to subdivision (b) of this section and based on the
reasons listed in this subdivision shall be considered requests for an
extension. (d) The provisions of this section shall not affect the number, amount or methods
of payments made under an academic performance award. Notes
